subject: Cancer
Golf
lead_paragraph: Pale and thin but still resilient, the golfer Seve Ballesteros said he has been given the mulligan of his life. Speaking for the first time about his battle with cancer, Ballesteros appeared in photos in the Spanish sports daily Marca. He has lost 33 pounds since being admitted to Madrid’s La Paz hospital in October. Ballesteros, 51, has had four operations and chemotherapy to destroy a malignant brain tumor. “This is the most important shot of my life,” he said. “I’m fighting to win my sixth major. Life has given me a second chance.”.
